before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"fodu4","text":"Make all preparations prior to thawing cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"89skk","text":"Collect ice and chill all buffers on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahb1","text":"Warm RPMI 10% FCS media in water bath","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hnd3","text":"Coat 5mL FACS polysterene tubes with 2% BSA in PBS before use to minimize cell loss.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"e9565","text":"Total-Seq labelling with demultiplexing","type":"header-one","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"18se0","text":"This protocol reflects a common experimental design where PBMC samples from multiple human donors are pooled together for Total-Seq (CITE-Seq) labelling. Often multiple samples from the same donor are to be profiled. An example is timepoint or treatment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dhqo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cpfqj","text":"Therefore we utilise 2 levels of multiplexing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"164b4","text":"The distinct donors may be pooled and later demultiplexed using SNP genotypes. This cannot discriminate genetically identical samples.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"add51","text":"Hashtag antibodies are used to multiplex to the timepoint or treatment","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffsb5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tga1","text":"The hashtag labelling must be done separately. We setup a distinct antibody staining pool for each timepoint or treatment. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9r13","text":"When other extracellular markers are to be profiled with Total-Seq we make prepare these antibodies in a pool and then split the pool into aliquots, adding a different hashtag to the antibody subpools.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"5qqiq","text":"Although PBMCs are a very robust cell type it is advised to work as quickly as possible after beginning thawing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fl8qh","text":"The large panels come lyophilized e.g TotalSeq-C Human Universal Cocktail, V1.0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgmqo","text":"The typical staining protocol is to block 500,000 cells in 25 uL of volume (cell staining buffer + Fc blocking reagent) and then add 25 uL of the resuspended antibodies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c1h94","text":"Total staining volume is 50uL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15f5t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"18csh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":19,"offset":54,"style":"bold"}],"key":"7msrb","text":"For 3 staining pools of a million cells total prepare 2 Total-Seq C vials","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bp2jg","text":"Place lyophilized panel vial(s) in an empty Eppendorf tube, pulse spin to collect powder to the bottom of the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

For example for 3 timepoints / treatments aliquot   into separate tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":107,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"euq1d","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e103n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"buojb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"15","error":false,"guid":"136D49D016D411EC8335A3D2EA57CA54","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"84okn","text":"Do not touch the bottom of the tube which could contain protein aggregates. Leave at least 2uL volume in centrifuged tube.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bst93","text":"We have tested staining with     of each hashtag antibody, 4x less than recommended by manufacturer which robustly labels PBMCs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":30,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a25qp","text":"You will need a distinct hashtag antibody set for each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbi0j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1o39c","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"48nql","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"0.25","error":false,"guid":"087991F00A2711ECAEBB4B69F1E51AEF","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":4}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6knom","text":"We currently label each sample with a unique combination of 2 hashtags at 1:4 dilution each. We have not compared with single hashtag labelled samples","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

Better leave more rather than less supernatant","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"98k3v","text":"While incubating take minimum 500,000 cells into a new eppendorf tube. You can use the 1.5mL used for cell counting to make this aliquot.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72b0n","text":"Pellet cells then snap freeze for the generation of bulk RNA-Seq libraries.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1moun","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bvae9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fef4n","text":"This step is required if you want to recover the original donor ID from each sample. If \"donor 1\", \"donor 2\" is an acceptable sample ID you may omit this step.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6itqk","text":"This step may be substituted for a SNP array. For Infinium Global Screening Array, 200ng of gDNA is required","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fasjj","text":"Add   carefully resuspending cells with pipette tip and   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":56,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4gdh7","text":"Use of swinging-bucket rotor is recommended for higher cell recovery.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"j58p","text":"Leave behind   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":13,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fm1u1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1.8","error":false,"guid":"B64223000A2811ECAEBB4B69F1E51AEF","id":0,"label":"Cell Staining buffer","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"400","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"CBB551300A2811ECAEBB4B69F1E51AEF","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"D8C261B00A2811ECAEBB4B69F1E51AEF","id":0,"label":"supernatant approx","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2ili","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eskn4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aolqp","text":"I have compared the 2 filters, the main benefit of Flowmi is the reduced volume loss.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2agu1","text":"We typically recover 2/3 cells based on number of events captured","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"FE973CA00F9911EC8990AFED638B8677","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: Pooling cells for Total-Seq and hashtag staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"41c2m","text":"Key to experimental design is ensuring the number of cells from each sample is as similar as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d23cb","text":"Refer to the cell pooling calculator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1n65c","text":"This protocol has only been used for Human Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells (PBMCs).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8sibf","text":"We largely follow 10x Genomics guidelines:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7n6l4","text":"https://support.10xgenomics.com/single-cell-gene-expression/sample-prep/doc/demonstrated-protocol-fresh-frozen-human-peripheral-blood-mononuclear-cells-for-single-cell-rna-sequencing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":182}],"data":{}},{"key":"63llj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"510dk","text":"We use Benzoase in the resuspension media at 50U/mL per sample (1:5000 dilution). When washing cells normal media (without Benzoase) is used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3r7fd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4eagj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1h93i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"C804D50B056511ECA9830A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://support.10xgenomics.com/single-cell-gene-expression/sample-prep/doc/demonstrated-protocol-fresh-frozen-human-peripheral-blood-mononuclear-cells-for-single-cell-rna-sequencing"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"53j4h","text":"Key is the slow addition of media to prevent a shock to cells during revival","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1jp4o","text":"Prior to counting resuspend in 9mL  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ff8dn","text":"Be sure to thoroughly mix cell suspensions before counting","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"9","error":false,"guid":"73C5D4F00A2711ECAEBB4B69F1E51AEF","id":0,"label":"Cell Staining buffer","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

steps.section: Pooling cells for Total-Seq and hashtag staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a5dc1","text":"First prepare the pool of samples from healthy donors in a 10mL tube. This will subsequently be aliquotted into each of the staining pools. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":39,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0vvs","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"373ga","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"at81v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8g9qd","text":"This design ensures more consistent representation of healthy donors across staining pools","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Pooling cells for Total-Seq and hashtag staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"77kmj","text":"Next pool the experimental samples that go into the antibody staining pools. You will have one staining pool per timepoint or treatment. Use a 10mL tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":14,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":27,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pooling cells for Total-Seq and hashtag staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cqnhh","text":"Add the healthy donor pool into each antibody staining pool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cejmu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"frpqt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1nrph","text":"We want the final number of healthy controls to be the same as each timepoint sample. If there are 3 staining pools add the healthy donors to 1/3rd cell number in each pool. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5d4ag","text":"In total we aim to recover equal cell numbers of controls and timepoints.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Pooling cells for Total-Seq and hashtag staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"80i1s","text":"Remove 500uL of cell suspension into 1.5mL tube and count cells. Make note of cell viability (\u003e95%) making a count of live cells and total cells (live + dead) in separate columns.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ra25","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2e1ao","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1pfip","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hen1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9mimk","text":"PBMCs are notoriously difficult to count with automated systems. Count manually or use a machine with fluorescence capability.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6trqb","text":"Count cells with manual haemocytometer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evepi","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aei7j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":24,"offset":98,"style":"bold"}],"key":"2jkh1","text":"This is the last cell count and is critical for obtaining the desired cell output from scRNA-Seq. I always count manually.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"92uf","text":"35,000 cells will be needed for each of the 10x Genomics captures","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpvp1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"derfk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d8ubq","text":"Approximately 20,000 barcode containing droplets, (17,000 singlets and 3,000 multiplets) will be obtained","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e34ap","text":"34uL is loaded on the 10x Genomics machine. Therefore a concentration of 1,029 cells/uL will need to be prepared per capture.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":73,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkek1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2u3l5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6d00e","text":"Always prepare double the volume of cell suspension you will need in case of wetting failures or blockages of the 10x Genomics microfluidics chip.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"24ku2","text":"Equilibrate the lyophilized panel vial(s) to room temperature for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mgu5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dh41v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ctqp","text":"Add   of distinct hashtag antibodies to each antibody cocktail tube =   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":9,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":70,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ea6tj","text":"0.5uL * 0.5ug/uL =   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2mps6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a9od1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4lk4f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"0.5","error":false,"guid":"9113975016D811EC8335A3D2EA57CA54","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"16","error":false,"guid":"AFA054B016D811EC8335A3D2EA57CA54","id":0,"label":"Total volume","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"0.25","error":false,"guid":"2F23AFD0306911EC93E76D09195B70CC","id":0,"label":"each hashtag","scientificNotation":false,"unit":4}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"rd8v","text":"Carefully record which hashtag antibodies are added to each antibody cocktail tube.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f4cht","text":"Avoid touching the bottom of the antibody stock tubes","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a92su","text":"Follow the guidelines of the relevant 10x Genomics protocol. The samples may be left overnight in the thermocycler after the reverse transcription step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"90m0e","text":"Resuspend cells in remaining 100uL and transfer to new 2mL eppendorf tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":51,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3huki","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9puje","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7gsmo","text":"10x Genomics have recomended a tube change to reduce antibody background. This should remove unbound antibodies that have stuck to the plastic.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":116,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1kike","text":"https://kb.10xgenomics.com/hc/en-us/articles/360041942012-How-can-I-optimize-my-TotalSeq-antibody-labeling-protocol-","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"951B672C3DD311EC845D0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://kb.10xgenomics.com/hc/en-us/articles/360041942012-How-can-I-optimize-my-TotalSeq-antibody-labeling-protocol-"},"mutability":"","type":"link"}}}}}}

title: CITE-Seq PBMCs with  demultiplexing
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"f0eog","text":"Provide prior notice to tissue culture room users before commencing processing of sample.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"413s0","text":"Room will only be available to staff processing material from acutely infected individuals until work is completed, area disinfected and waste removed for decontamination","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f8sv","text":"Turn on BSCII and allow time to start up (5 minutes to allow air to purge)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vq1d","text":"Disinfect the BSC with either 80% ethanol or Cavicide and have disinfectant close to BSC.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4pnlr","text":"Ensure that the BSCII cabinet is equipped with the following:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5bgo","text":"Biohazard waste bucket, with new autoclave bag","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"82k76","text":"Biocan for tips and pipettes","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2olqu","text":"Place only required items in cabinet ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8luak","text":"Do not overfill biohazard bins (no greater than 80% filled).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lm9h","text":"Work should be conducted in the centre of the BSCII.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rtsj","text":"The grille of the BSCII must not be covered with any items that will restrict airflow. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6llv","text":"Minimise the amount of equipment in the BSCII. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dk56e","text":"When using pipette tips, dispose directly into biocan within the BSCII. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ac9i","text":"If gloves become contaminated, remove them within the BSCII and dispose of them in the biohazard bag.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80ujr","text":"Liquid waste will be treated with 10,000ppm sodium hypochlorite for a minimum of 60 min prior to disposal down the sink with a strong flush of water. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"797rj","text":"Use aerosol caps on centrifuge buckets","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcosu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
